intro: Malveopsis rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's malva, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and grows as an herbaceous perennial. Malveopsis rusbyi is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
